attributes.action: Introduce mental health days for people effected with mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
"More than 15 million people - 30% of the UK population - live with one or more long-term conditions, and more than 4 million of these people will also have mental health problems."  -  Mental health foundation 

We need help the millions of people who suffering with long term mental health conditions, As a teacher mental health is something many teachers suffer and we as a collective need to allow people to actually care for their selves.
attributes.background: Allow workers to take mental health days that will not effect their attendance at work. Sometimes a single day to recuperate is needed in order to boost someone's mental health.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want people to be entitled to additional time off work for their mental health, but it's not clear what arrangements you want to apply to these days - for example whether they need to be agreed with the employer (like annual leave), and what if any pay employees should be entitled to on these days (as different arrangements apply to annual leave, sick leave and other types of leave).

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
